q1.question: What is Sealfie?
q1.answer: Sealfie is a biometric authentication platform that prevents executive impersonation fraud. It verifies identities through selfies combined with advanced liveness detection, making it impossible for criminals to use deepfakes or stolen credentials to impersonate executives.

q2.question: How does Sealfie prevent deepfake fraud?
q2.answer: Sealfie uses advanced liveness detection that analyzes biometric markers invisible to deepfake AI. It detects 3D facial geometry, micro-movements, and other biological factors that current deepfake technology cannot replicate. Each verification is recorded on blockchain for immutable proof.

q3.question: What is Business Email Compromise (BEC)?
q3.answer: Business Email Compromise (BEC) is a cyberattack where criminals impersonate executives to authorize fraudulent wire transfers or credential changes. The FBI reports $5 billion in annual losses globally. Deepfake technology makes these attacks increasingly sophisticated and harder to detect with traditional training.

q5.answer: Yes. Biometric templates are encrypted end-to-end and stored using zero-knowledge architecture. Only mathematical representations (not photos) are stored. We cannot access your biometric data. Sealfie is GDPR compliant.

q6.question: How much does Sealfie cost?
q6.answer: Plans start at $195 per person per year for executive fraud protection. Enterprise pricing available for teams of 10+ users. Free security challenge demo lets you test deepfake protection before purchase.

q7.question: What platforms does Sealfie support?
q7.answer: Sealfie works across email (Gmail, Outlook), messaging (Slack, Teams, WhatsApp), and any communication platform. Recipients verify authenticity through a web link - no app installation required. Available on iOS and Android app stores.

q8.question: How is Sealfie different from 2FA?
q8.answer: Traditional 2FA (SMS codes, authenticator apps) can be bypassed through social engineering and SIM swaps. Sealfie uses biometric verification tied to the actual person, creating physical proof that cannot be stolen or faked. It also provides blockchain-based audit trails for compliance.

questions.question: What is Sealfie?
questions.shortAnswer: Sealfie stops deepfake fraud and executive impersonation by verifying identities with a simple selfie. When someone requests payment or sensitive actions, Sealfie instantly confirms it's really them - not a criminal using AI-generated deepfakes or stolen credentials.
questions.expandedContent:
Business Email Compromise (BEC) costs companies $5 billion annually. Criminals use AI to create convincing deepfake videos and voices, impersonate executives, and trick employees into sending money to fraudulent accounts.

How Sealfie protects you:

  • Simple selfie verification - no complex security training needed
  • Instant identity confirmation in 30 seconds
  • Stops deepfakes, fake vendors, and compromised accounts
  • Complete audit trail for compliance

Real example: ARUP Hong Kong lost $25M when criminals used deepfakes of 6 executives in a video call. Sealfie would have stopped this attack instantly.

questions.question: How does it work?
questions.shortAnswer: When you receive a suspicious request (payment, credential change, sensitive action), you simply ask the person to verify with Sealfie. They take a quick selfie, and Sealfie instantly confirms their identity. It's as simple as taking a photo, but stops even the most sophisticated deepfakes.
questions.expandedContent:

  1. Open Sealfie app on your phone
  2. Take a quick selfie
  3. Done - verification sent in 30 seconds

For the person checking identity:

  1. Receive suspicious email/request
  2. Click "Verify with Sealfie"
  3. Get instant confirmation it's really them

What makes it secure:

  • Advanced liveness detection stops photo/video deepfakes
  • Biometric verification tied to the real person
  • Multi-source checks (phone, email, biometrics)
  • Every verification is recorded for audit trail

  • No photos or facial scans are ever stored
  • Only encrypted mathematical models transmitted
  • Zero-knowledge proof - we verify without seeing your data

questions.question: Can Sealfie stop AI-generated deepfakes?
questions.shortAnswer: Yes. Sealfie's advanced liveness detection technology identifies AI-generated deepfakes in real-time. Unlike traditional security training that relies on humans spotting fakes, Sealfie uses biometric verification that deepfakes cannot replicate.
questions.expandedContent:
Why deepfakes are dangerous:

  • AI can clone voices with 3 seconds of audio
  • Video deepfakes look identical to real video calls
  • Employees cannot reliably detect sophisticated fakes
  • Criminals use deepfakes to bypass traditional verification

How Sealfie detects deepfakes:

  • Multi-factor liveness detection (blink patterns, micro-movements, depth analysis)
  • Biometric matching against registered template
  • Device fingerprinting and location verification
  • Real-time analysis - no pre-recorded videos accepted

Real-world protection: Even if criminals have your executive's voice, face, and email access, they cannot pass Sealfie verification without physical access to the registered device and biometric data.

questions.question: What happens if my phone is lost or stolen?
questions.shortAnswer: Your biometric data remains secure. Since it never leaves your device, thieves cannot access it. You can remotely deactivate your account, transfer to a new device, and re-register biometrics in minutes.
questions.expandedContent:
Immediate protection:

  1. Contact Sealfie support or use web portal to suspend account
  2. Your biometric data is locked to the stolen device (useless to thieves)
  3. All pending verifications are automatically rejected
  4. Audit log shows no unauthorized access attempts

Recovery process:

  1. Install Sealfie on new device
  2. Verify identity through secondary authentication (email + admin approval)
  3. Re-register biometrics on new device
  4. Resume normal operations in under 30 minutes

Why you're protected:

  • Biometric templates are device-specific and encrypted
  • No cloud storage of facial scans or fingerprints
  • Device binding prevents unauthorized transfers
  • Multi-factor account recovery with admin oversight

Why Sealfie works for small businesses:

  • No IT department required
  • No technical integration with existing systems
  • No server setup or maintenance
  • No special hardware beyond smartphones
  • No coding or configuration files

Simple setup process:

  1. Download Sealfie from App Store/Google Play
  2. Register company admin account
  3. Add executives by email
  4. They install app and register biometrics
  5. Start verifying - it's that simple

Support included:

  • Email and chat support for all questions
  • Video walkthrough of setup process
  • Pre-configured templates for common workflows
  • 30-day onboarding assistance

For enterprises with IT teams: Optional API integration, SSO, and custom workflows available.
